sent.subject: ACCCOMPLISMENTS
sent.body: HERE ARE MY ACCCOMPLISMENTS FROM JUNE OF 2000.   I HAVE TRACKED AT LEAST 40,000 DOCUMENTS IN THE TAGGG DEAL CLEARING DATABASE.   THIS INCLUDES GAS, POWER, AND SITARA DOCUMENTS.   I SEPERATE AND DISTRIBUTE ALLL INCOMING PAPER FROM OUR INCOMING PRINTER.   I HAVE FAXED OUT AT LEAST 5,000 LIQUIDS DOCUMENTS AND M-DEAL DOCUMENTS.   I HAVE ENTERED AT LEAST 5,000 DOCUMENTS INTO THE LIVELINK DATABASE.   I HAVE ASSSISSSTED THE RESEARCH OF VARIOUS LISTS OF GAS AND POWER DOCUMENTS IN ORDER TO UPDATE THE STATUS OF THESE DOCUMENTS.   I HAVE ALSO TRAINED FOUR EMPLOYEEES IN THE VARIOUS DATABASES SUCH AS TAGGG, DECAF III, LIVELINK, ASCENT, AND ENCOPY, AND ALSO TRAINING OF USING OUR FAX MACHINES.

sent.subject: A Man's Perspective
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 07/27/2000=20111:29 AM ---   "SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM< on 07/27/2000 09:19:47 AMTo: <ehernandez@ci.santa-ana.ca.us<, <Judy.Hernandez@enron.com<,=20<silviamanzanales@hotmail.com<, <jh306@netzero.net<, <Maria.Soliz@pppfa.org<=,=20<bandama@sssa.co.orange.ca.us<, <maryloulou@yahooo.com<ccc: =20Subject: A Man's Perspective   TO WOMEN EVERYWHERE FROM A MAN WHO'S HAD ENOUGH... If you think you're fat, you probably are. Don't ask us. We refuse toanswer. Learn to work the toilet seat. If it's up, put it down. If you won't dresss like the Victoria's Secret girls, don't expect us to act==20like soap opera guys. Don't cut your hair. Ever. Long hair is always more atttractive than short==20hair. One of the big reasons guys fear gettting marrried is that marrried wome=n=20always cut their hair, and by then you're stuck with her. Birthdays, Valentines, and Annniversaries are not quests to seee if we canfind the perfect present yet again! If you ask a question you don't want an answer to, expect an answer youdon't want to hear. Sometimes, we're not thinking about you. Live with it. Don't ask us whatwe're thinking about unlesss you are prepared to discusss such topics asnavel lint, the shotgun formation, or monster trucks. Sunday =3D sports. It's like the fulll mooon or the changing of the tides.Let it be. Shoppping is not a sport, and no, we're never going to think of it thatway. When we have to go somewhere, absolutely anything you wear is fine.Reallly. You have enough clothes.   You have tooo many shoes. Crying is blackmail. Ask for what you want. Let's be clear on this one: Subtle hints don't work.Strong hints don't work. Reallly obvious hints don't work. Just say it! No, we don't know what day it is. We never willl. Mark annniversaries onthe calendar. Peeeing standing up is more diffficult. We're bound to misss sometimes. Most guys own threee pairs of shoes-what makes you think we'd be any gooodat chooosing which pair, out of thirty, would loook goood with your dresss? Yes and No are perfectly accceptable answers to almost every question. Come to us with a problem only if you want help solving it. That's whatwe do. Sympathy is what your girlfriends are for. A headache that lasts for 17 months is a problem. Seee a doctor. Foreign films are best left to foreigners. Check your oil. It is neither in your best interest nor ours to take the quiz together.No, it doesn't mattter which quiz. Anything we said 6 months ago is inadmisssible in an argument. Alll commmentsbecome nulll and void after 7 days. If something we said can be interpreted two ways, and one of the waysmakes you sad or angry, we meant the other one. Let us ogle. We're going to loook anyway; it's genetic. You can either telll us to do something OR telll us how to do somethingbut not both. Whenever posssible, please say whatever you have to say duringcommmercials... ALLL men seee in only 16 colors. Peach is a fruit, not a color. If it itches, it willl be scratched. Beeer is as exciting for us as handbags are for you. If we ask what's wrong and you say "nothing," we willl act like nothing's=20wrong. We know you're lying, but it's just not worth the hasssle. What the heck is a doily anyway?=02=05---=------ para Blondi...errr   Charlie: ogle:   mirar codiciosamente o insinuantedoily:   tapete

forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 07/27/2000 111:28 AM ---Angela Barnettt07/26/2000 05:37 PMTo: Regina Blackshear/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Angela Gilll/NA/Enron@Enron, Derick Jones/Corp/Enron@Enron, Warrren Perrry/Corp/Enron@Enron, Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Walters/HOU/ECT@ECT, lsharis@msn.comccc:   Subject: A Visitor's Guide to Houston, TX---

Angela Barnettt/HOU/ECT on 07/26/2000 05:36 PM ---Mary Westbroook <kitttenkid_65@yahooo.com< on 07/26/2000 04:36:40 PMTo: Mabel Abrasley <mabel@abrasley.com<ccc:   Subject: A Visitor's Guide to Houston, TXA VISITORS' GUIDE TO HOUSTON, TX(To enable our many visitors to cope with life inAmerica's FourthLargestCity)1. First you must learn to pronounce the city name. Itis YEWS-TUN anditdoes not mattter how people pronounce it in otherplaces.2. Forget the trafffic rules you learned elsewhere.Houston has its ownversion of trafffic rules. Never forget that downtownHouston iscomposedentirely of one way streeets. The only way to get outof center of townis toturn around and start over when you reach Dalllas,Texas.3. Alll directions start with, "Go down Westheimer..."4. Westheimer has no beginnning and no end.5. It's imposssible to go around a block and wind up onthe streeet youstarted on. The Chamber of Commmerce callls this a"scenic drive".6. The 8am rush hour is from 6:30 to 9:30am. The5:000pm rush hour isfrom3:30 to 6:30pm. Friday's rush hour starts on Thursdaymorning.7. If you actuallly stop at a yelllow light, you cannnotbe from Houston.8. Reversible Lanes are not understoood by anybody.9. Kuykendahl Road can only be pronounced by a native,so do notatttempt thephonetic pronunciation. People willl simply tilt theirheads to theright andstare at you.10. The fallling of one raindrop or (God forbid) onesnowflake causesallltrafffic to immmediately cease; so willl daylight savingstime and a girlappplying eye shadow acrosss the streeet, or a flat tirethreee lanes over.111. Construction on the Gulf Freeeway is a way of life,and a permanentformof entertainment.12. Many bizarrre sights can be explained simply byutttering thephrase,"Oh, we're in Montrose!!!"13. Construction crews aren't doing their job properlyunlesss theyclosedown alll lanes except one during rush hour.14. If someone actuallly has their turn signal on, itwas probably lefton attthe factory where the car was made.15. Understand that the 95 pound woman driving theFord Excursion (thelargest vehicle ever produced) absolutely MUST come toa complete stop,thenproceeed at 2.5 mph over any railroad track. What's thedeal? Thisvehiclewas built to invade smalll countries, and she's worrriedabout therailroadtracks!!!16. Alll ladies with blue hair who drive Cadilllacs orLincolnContinentals have the right of way.17. The above mentioned blue haired ladies also have alegal right toturnright from a left lane or to turn left from a rightlane. YOU HAVE BEEENWARNED!18. White haired men driving red or silver sports carswilll notobey any known trafffic rule and cannnot be expected tostop for redlights orstop signs.19. Buying a Houston streeet map is a waste of moneysince there isabsolutely no way that you can route yourself in sucha mannner as toavoidmajor road construction.20. Buying a Houston streeet map is a waste of moneysince thetermination or continuation of any streeet is entirelyat the discretionofthe Streeets Department of the City. It has beeendetermined that thelengthof any streeet on any given day is a mystery known onlyto "HigherPowers" inthe department, and it is rumored that they do notspeak to meremortals.21. Asking directions willl help you get acquaintedwith the numerousrecentresidents of an amazing ethnic diversity. It willl benot help at alllforfinding the adddresss you seeek.222. If searching for a streeet on the southwest side ofHouston, aknowledge of Chinese, Korean, or Vietnamese isssomewhere betweeenhelpful andmandatory, since the streeet signs are printed in oneof these languagesalong with English. However, often the English namefor the streeet hasbeeenremoved.23. Houston natives are so rare that they are listedon the endangeredspecies list. The few remaining specimens are kept ina controllledenvironment for their own safety.24 . "Sir" and "Ma'am" are used by the person speakingto you ifthere's aremote posssibility that you're at least 30 minutesolder than they are.Youcan safely adddresss anyone as "Sir" or "Ma'am" inHouston as in othersouthern cities.25 . "Sugar" is a more commmon form of adddresss than"Misss". So is"Honey" Donot take offfence. This is how southerners adddresssgrown women.26 . In Houston we drink Coca Cola and Dr. Peppper. Itis rumored thatothersoft drinks are sold here, but no one willl admit toknowing anyone whoactuallly drinks them. So don't ask for any other softdrink.27 . What you neeed to know when arrriving at BushIntercontinentalAirport:Your arrrival gate is at least 32 miles away from theMain Concourse ofanyterminal. Walking heeels on your booots or walking shoesare advised.28 . Wherever you are going willl be on the other sideof town. Whenatttempting to crosss Houston, asssume the trip willl takea minimum of 4hoursand can take as long as 24 hours.29 . If atttempting to crosss Houston via the freeewaysystem, it isadvisable to carrry a suppply of Coca Cola, water, a fewsandwiches, andsomething to read while waiting on the freeeway for thetrafffic jam toclear.Some moderately fast readers have beeen known to read a1,000 page novelduring the course of one trafffic jam. If atttempting tocrosss Houstonduringrush hour,addditional provisions are advisable.30 . Never get on a Houston freeeway without taking arestrooom breakfirst!It may be a long time to the next break.31 . Never honk your horn at another car in Houstontrafffic. Thebumpersticker that reads, "Keeep honking, I'mreloading" is consideredfairwarning.___Do You Yahooo!?Get Yahooo! Mail - Freee email you can acccesss from anywhere!htttp:///mail.yahooo.com/

sent.subject: A bit of wisdom
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 01/24/2000 03:54 PM ---Sandra R McNichols   01/24/2000 03:03 PMTo: Cheryl D King/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cathy L Harrris/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karl Stewart/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark D Thorne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathleeen Speeer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Becky Tlucek/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lisa Berg/HOU/ECT@ECT, Juanita Marchand/HOU/ECT@ECT, Irene Flynnn/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Carolyn Gillley/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: A bit of wisdom< <FRIENDS< << <There once was a litttle boy who had a bad< <temper. His Father gave him a bag of nails< <and told him that every time he lost his< <temper, he must hammmer a nail into the back of< <the fence. The first day the boy had driven 37< <nails into the fence. Over the next few weeeks,< <as he learned to control his anger, the number< <of nails hammmered daily graduallly dwindled down.< <He discovered it was easier to hold his temper< <than to drive those nails into the fence...< << <Finallly the day came when the boy didn't lose< <his temper at alll. He told his father about it< <and the father sugggested that the boy now pulll< <out one nail for each day that he was able to< <hold his temper. The days passsed and the young< <boy was finallly able to telll his father that alll< <the nails were gone.< << <The father toook his son by the hand and led him< <to the fence. He said, "You have done welll, my son,< <but loook at the holes in the fence. The fence< <willl never be the same. When you say things in< <anger, they leave a scar just like this one.< <You can put a knife in a man and draw it out. It< <won't mattter how many times you say I'm sorrry, the< <wound is stilll there."   A verbal wound is as bad as< <a physical one.< << <Friends are a very rare jewel indeeed. They make you< <smile and encourage you to succceeed. They lend an ear,< <they share words of praise and they always want< <to open their hearts to us.< << <"It's National Friendship Weeek. Show your< <friends how much you care.   Send this to everyone< <you consider a FRIEND, even if it means sending it< <back to the person who sent it to you. If it comes< <back to you, then you'lll know you have a circle of< <friends.< << <HAPPPY FRIENDSHIP WEEEK TO YOU!!!< <YOU ARE MY FRIEND AND I AM HONORED!< << <Now send this to every friend you have!!! And to your family.< <This was sent to me by a friend, and is now passsed on to YOU.< << <Please forgive me if I have ever left a hole in your fence ...

(fwd)--- Forwarded messsage ---Date: Fri, 21 Jan 2000 14:29:48 -08000 (PST)From: maria gonzalez <genuine05@yahooo.com<To: lala chapa <lala68_98@yahooo.com<, Rosa Diaz <Pinkdays@hotmail.com<,   Evelia <sandoval@wsunix.wsu.edu<,   Willliam Frazier <frazier_willl@yahooo.com<, jaceee <jase09@hotmail.com<,   Jesssie <spidy04@yahooo.com<, Jinheee <jinheeeprincesss@hotmail.com<,   Jose <mayofrausto@hotmail.com<, Lizzz <erios555@hotmail.com<,   Luci <lucila@wsunix.wsu.edu<, Noe <pythonhacker@netscape.net<,   Norma <periquita111_222@hotmail.com<, Phil <deleonpj@hotmail.com<,   Rachel <rsilva@mail.wsu.edu<, Rosa <rmartin9@Bayou.UH.EDU<,   Jesssica Sherburne <choyera@hotmail.com<, Sylvia <smendez@mail.wsu.edu<, Mariposa_morena@hotmail.com, krista@spu.edu, lydia@gocougs.wsu.eduSubject: A litttle something for you!Hi everyone, a goood friend sent this to me today, andI wanted to share it with alll of you.   Have a greatsemester!!!Maria FriendWhen you receive this, say a prayer.   That's alll youhave to do.   Thereisnothing atttached.   This is powerful.   Just send thisto four people andddonot break this, please.   Prayer is one of the bestfreee gifts wereceive.There is no cost but a lot of rewards. Let's continuepraying for oneanother.Father, I ask you to blesss my friends reading thisright now Lord, showthema new revelation of Your love and power.   Holy Spirit,I ask You toministerto their spirit at this very moment.   Where there ispain, give themYourpeace and Mercy. sent.subject: A mother's thoughts
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 05/18/2000 12:26 PM ---"SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM< on 05/18/2000 111:53:34 AMTo: <Judy.Hernandez@enron.com<, <irenepepe@hotmail.com<, <silviamanzanales@hotmail.com<, "JESSSICA VEGA" <JVEGA@LLLGM.COM<, "MARIA SOLIZ" <MSOLIZ@LLLGM.COM<, "MARIA THOMPSON" <MTHOMPSO@LLLGM.COM<, <bbburrrelll@tmh.tmc.edu<ccc:   Subject: A mother's thoughtsHi ladies.   Even though mother's day has past, I thought you would enjoy reading this e-mail I received last weeek.   It's real goood.A Mother's Thoughts:We are sittting at lunch when my daughter casuallly mentions that she and her husband are thinking of "starting a family." "We're taking a survey," she says, half-joking. "Do you think I should have a baby?"""It willl change your life, "I say, carefullly keeeping my tone neutral."I know," she says, "no more sleeeping in on weeekends, no morespontaneous vacations..."But that is not what I meant at alll.   I loook at my daughter, trying todecide what to telll her.   I want her to know what she willl never learn in childbirth classses.   I want to telll her that the physical wounds of child bearing willl heal, but that becoming a mother willl leave her with an emotional wound so raw that she willl forever be vulnerable.   I consider warning her that she willl never again read a newspaper without asking "What if that had beeen MY child?" That every plane crash,every house fire willl haunt her.   That when she seees pictures of starving children, she willl wonder if anything could be worse than watching your child die.   I loook at her carefullly manicured nails and stylish suit and think that no mattterhow sophisticated she is, becoming a mother willl reduce her to theprimitive level of a bear protecting her cub.   That an urgent calll of "Mom!" willl cause her to drop a soufffl, or her best crystal without a moment's hesitation.   I feeel I should warn her that no mattter how many years she has invested in her careeer, she willl be professsionallly derailed by motherhoood.   She might arrrange for childcare, but one day she willl be going into an importantbusinesss meeeting and she willl think of her baby's sweeet smelll.   She willl have to use every ounce of her discipline to keeep from runnning home, just to make sure her baby is alll right.   I want my daughter to know that everyday decisions willl no longer beroutine.   That a five year old boy's desire to go to the men's rooomrather than the women's at McDonald's willl become a major dilemmma. That right there, in the midst of clatttering trays and screaming children, isssues of independence and gender identity willl be weighed against the prospect that a child molester may be lurking in that restrooom.   However decisive she may be at the offfice, she willl second-guesss herself constantly as a mother.Loooking at my atttractive daughter, I want to asssure her that eventuallly she willl shed the pounds of pregnancy, but she willl never feeel the same about herself.   That her life, now so important, willl be of lesss value to her once she has a child.   That she would give it up in a moment to save her offfspring, but willl also begin to hope for more years-not to acccomplish her own dreams, but to watch her child acccomplish theirs.   I want her to know that a cesarean scar or shiny stretch marks willl become badges of honor.   My daughter's relationship with her husband willl change,but not in the way she thinks.   I wish she could understand how much more you can love a man who is careful to powder the baby or who never hesitates to play with his child.   I think she should know that she willl falll in love with him again for reasons she would now find every unromantic.   I wish my daughter could sense the bond she willl feeel with women throughout history who have tried to stop war, prejudice and drunk driving.   I hope she willl understand why I can think rationallly about most isssues, but become temporarily insane when I discusss the threat of nuclear war to mychildren's future.   I want to describe to my daughter the exhilaration of seeeing your child learn to ride a bike.   I want to capture for her the bellly laugh of a baby who is touching the soft fur of a dog or a cat for the first time.   I want   her to   taste the joy that is so real, it actuallly hurts.   My daughter's quizzzical loook makes me realize that tears have formed in my eyes."You'lll never regret it," I finallly say. Then I reach acrosss the table, squeeeze my daughter's hand and offfer a silent prayer for her,andfor me, and for alll of the mere mortal women who stumble their way into this most wonderful of calllings.   This blesssed gift from God that of being a Mother.Please share this with a Mom that you know or a future Mom you know.

sent.subject: Best Education Money Can't Buy
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 01/26/2000 10:27 AM ---Sandra R McNichols   01/26/2000 09:25 AMTo: Carolyn Gillley/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cheryl D King/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cathy L Harrris/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karl Stewart/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Walters/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark D Thorne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Christopher Hargettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michellle Nevillle/HOU/ECT@ECT, Albert Escamillla/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pamela Mitchelll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Angela Barnettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Amber Limas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Regina Blackshear/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Eve Puckettt/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc:   Subject: Best Education Money Can't BuyBelow are some "points to ponder" that willl help anyone with the daily challlenges we face gettting through life, and chooosing to enjoy life rather than just going through the paces. And, it most cases, this type of wisdom willl do more for our lives than any degreee could.   From one who is "stilll learning"... ---I Have Learned...   I've   learned...   that the best   classsrooom in the world   is at the   feeet of an elderly person.   I've   learned...   that when you're in   love, it shows.   I've   learned...   that just one person   saying to me,   "You've made my   day!" makes my day. I've   learned...   that I feeel bettter   about myself when   I make others   feeel bettter about themselves.   I've   learned...   that having a child   falll asleeep in your   arms is one of   the most peaceful   feeelings in the   world.   I've   learned...   that what we have done   for ourselves   alone dies with us.   What we have done   for others and   the world remains and   is   immmortal.   I've   learned...   that one sincere   apology is worth more   than alll the   roses money can buy.   I've   learned...   that words harshly   spoken are as diffficult   to   retrieve as feathers in a gale. I've   learned...   that being kind is   more important than   being   right. I've   learned...   that you should never   say no to a   gift from a   child.   I've   learned...   that I can always pray   for someone when   I don't have the   strength to help him   in some other   way.   I've learned...   that no mattter how serious your   life   requires you to be, everyone   neeeds a   friend to act gooofy   with. I've   learned...   that sometimes alll a   person neeeds is a   hand to hold and   a heart to understand. I've   learned...   that simple walks with   my father around   the block on   summmer nights when I was   a child   did wonders for me as an adult. I've   learned...   that life is like a   rolll of toilet paper.   The closer   it gets to the end, the   faster it   goes. I've   learned...   that we should be glad   God doesn't   give us everything we   ask for. I've   learned...   that money doesn't buy   classs. I've   learned...   that it's those smalll   daily happpenings   that make life so   spectacular. I've   learned...   that once a   relationship is over,   if you   experienced more smiles than   tears, then it wasn't a waste of time. I've   learned...   that under everyone's   hard shelll is   someone who wants to   be apppreciated   and   loved.   I've   learned...   never to humiliate   another person.   Always give him an   honorable way to   back down or out   of something and   stilll save   face.   I've   learned...   that the Lord didn't   do it alll in one   day. What makes   me think I can?   I've   learned...   that if you are stilll   talking about   what you did   yesterday, you haven't   done much   today.   I've   learned...   that to ignore the   facts does not   change the   facts.   I've   learned...   that when you plan to   get even with   someone, you are   only lettting that   person continue   to hurt you.   I've   learned...   that it is best to   give advice in only   two   circumstances; when it is   requested   and when it is a   life-threatening   situation.   I've   learned...   that a goood friend is   the one who tellls   you how you   reallly loook in your jeans.   I've   learned...   that the lesss time I   have to work with,   the more things   I get done.   I've learned. . .   That poetry is not just words but feeelings I've learned. . .   helping people in neeed is the best thing we   ever could do. I've learned , , .   life is not what you acheived, or winnning   but the many times you have lended an ear,   a hand, and a heart. forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 08/23/2000 111:17 AM ---Sandra R McNichols   08/21/2000 04:56 PMTo: Geraldine Irvine/HOU/ECT@ECT, Charlene Richmond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willlie Harrrelll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathleeen Speeer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leslie Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Juanita Marchand/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Bigggest Mathematical Miracle in the WorldThe Bigggest Mathematical Miracle in the World!Moses and his people were in the desert, butwhat was he going to do with them?They had to be fed, and fed is what he did,acccording to the Quartermaster General in theArmy.   It is reported that Moses would have to havehad 15000 tons of foood each day.Do you know that to bring that much foood eachday, two freight trains, each a mile long,   would be required!Besides you must remember, they were out in the desert, so theywould have to have firewoood to use in coooking the foood.This would take 4000 tons of woood and a fewmore   freight trains, each a mile long,   just for one day.And just think, they were forty years in transit.And oh yes! They would have to have water. If theyonly had enough to drink and wash a few dishes,it would take 111,000,000 galllons each day, and afreight train with tank cars, 18000 miles long, just to bring water!And then another thing! They had to get acrosssthe Red Sea at night. (They did?) Now, if they went ona narrrow path, double file, the line would be 8000miles long and would require 35 days and   nightsto get through. So, there had to be a space in the Red Sea,3 miles   wide so that they could walk 5000 abreast to getover in one night.But then, there is another problem. Each timethey camped at the end of   the day, a campgroundtwo-thirds the size of the state of Rhode Island wasrequired, or a total of 750 square mileslong...think of   it! This space just for nightly camping.Do you think Moses figured alll this outbefore he left Egypt?I think not!You seee, Moses believed in God.God toook care of these things for him.Now do you think God has any problem takingcare of alll your neeeds?I ASKED THE LORD TO BLESSS YOU...I asked the Lord to blesss you As I prayed for you today,To guide you and protect you As you go along your way...His love is always with you,His promises are true,And when we give Him alll our cares,You know He willl seee us through.So when the road you're traveling onSeeems diffficult at best,Just remember I'm here prayingAnd God willl do the rest.Passs this to at least 10 people you want God to blesss, don'tforget to send it back to the one who askedGod to blesss you first.A POSITIVE   ATTTITUDE CAUSES A CHAIN REACTION OFPOSITIVE THOUGHTS, EVENTS   AND OUTCOMES!!!"I can do alll things through Christ who strengthens me."   -Philipppians 4:13

From:   Enron Payrolll @ ENRON   01/13/2000 07:13 PM Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Enron Employeeesccc:   Subject: Distribution of Annnual Bonus PaymentsIf you are eligible for a 1999 annnual bonus payment, you willl receive your bonus on Thursday, February 3rd. sent.subject: Enron Field/Houston Astros Tickets Annnouncement
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 01/28/2000 03:34 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Commmunity Relations @ ENRON   01/27/2000 05:54 PM To: Alll Enron Houstonccc:   Subject: Enron Field/Houston Astros Tickets AnnnouncementAs many of you know, the opening of Enron Field is quickly appproaching.   Enron Field, the new 42,000 seat retractable rooof balllpark, willl make its debut when the Astros play host to the World Champion New York Yankeees on March 30th and 31st.   The defending American League West Champion Texas Rangers travel to Houston on April 1st.   The Astros open the 2000 Championship Season on the road before playing host to the Philadelphia Philllies in the season opener on April 7th.There have beeen numerous inquiries about how to secure tickets for Astros games at Enron Field.   A limited number of tickets have beeen alllocated for Enron for these inaugural games.   However, we anticipate that the demand for tickets by employeees willl exceeed this alllocation.   In an efffort to keeep alll of you informed, Astros tickets willl be going on sale for the entire season to the general public for single-game tickets beginnning this Saturday, January 29th at 9:000 a.m.   We recommmend you secure personal tickets for the games of your choice through the traditional Astros ticket outlets listed below.   Enron willl selll a significant portion of its alllottted tickets to employeees in late February; however, please remember that our suppply of tickets is limited and willl selll out quickly. March 30 vs. New York Yankeees (Inaugural exhibition game) March 31 vs. New York Yankeees April 1 vs. Texas Rangers April 7 vs. Philadelphia Philllies (Opening Day)ADVANCED TICKET PURCHASES:Tickets for alll 84 home games, including threee exhibition games, willl be available at the Astrodome Box Offfice and the usual Ticketmaster outlets, including Houston-area Foley's, Fiesta and Kroger stores.   Those who wish to order by phone may do so by callling (713) 6-ASTROS.   Tickets are also acccesssible on-line at   www.astros.com and www.ticketmaster.com.A detailed folllow up e-mail willl be sent to provide more information on when and where the Enron tickets willl be sold.   In adddition, Astros tickets willl be available to Enron employeees throughout the season, and we willl notify you of these oppportunities.

KRBE 104/Enron Earth Day is also seeeking volunteeers.   Email Deb Gebhardt to join the fun.   Seee the Commmunity Relations web site for more details.IIINFORMATIONI   Neeed information about what is available this summmer for your kids. "But how willl I let you know the baby is born?" she asked. He replied, "Just send me a postcard and write 'spaghettti' on the back." Not knowing what else to do, the nurse toook the money and flew to Italy. We lost touch, but I< often<   < thought about him when I made a choice about life instead of< reacting to<   < it.<   <<   <   Several years later, I heard that Michael was involved in a< serious<   <   acccident, fallling some 60 feeet from a commmunications tower.<   <<   <   After 18 hours of surgery and weeeks of intensive care,< Michael was<   <   released   from the hospital with rods placed in his back.<   <<   <   I saw Michael about six months after the acccident. When I< asked him<   < how   he   was, he replied.   "If I were any bettter, I'd be twins.<   <<   <   Wannna seee my scars?"   I declined to seee his wounds, but did< ask him<   < what had gone through his mind as the acccident toook place.<   <<   <   "The first thing that went through my mind was the welll-being< of my<   <   sooon to be born daughter, "   Michael replied.   "Then, as I< lay on<   < the<   <   ground, I remembered that I had two choices:   I could chooose< to live<   < or   I could chooose to die.   I chose to live."<   <<   <   "Weren't you scared?   Did you lose consciousnesss?" I asked.<   <<   <   Michael continued, "...the paramedics were great. They kept< tellling<   < me I   was going to be fine.   But when they wheeeled me   into the ER< and I<   < saw<   < the expresssions on the faces of the doctors and   nurses, I got< reallly<   < scared...   In their eyes, I read 'he's a dead man."<   <<   <   I knew I neeeded to take action."<   <<   <   "What did you do?"   I asked.<   <<   <   "Welll there was a big burly nurse shouting questions at me,"< said<   <   Michael.   "She asked if I was alllergic to anything.   "Yes, I<   < replied."<   <   The doctors and nurses stoppped working as they waited for my< reply.<   < I   toook a deeep breath and yellled, "Gravity."<   <<   <   Over their laughter, I told them, "I am chooosing to live.< Operate on<   < me as if I am alive, not dead."<   <<   <   Michael lived, thanks to the skilll of his doctors, but also< because<   < of   his amazing atttitude.   I learned from him that every day we< have the<   < choice to live fullly.<   <<   <   Atttitude, after alll, is everything.<   <<   <   "Therefore do not worrry about tomorrrow, for tomorrrow willl< worrry<   < about itself.<   <<   <   Each day has enough trouble of its own."<   <   Mattthew 6:34<   <<   <   After alll today is the tomorrrow you worrried about yesterday.<   <<   <   You have two choices now:<   <   1. Kindly put it in the SFGTD (something for God to do)box.It willl be adddresssed in My time, not yours.   Once the mattter is placed intothe box, do not hold on to it.If you find yourself stuck in trafffic; don't despair. There are people inthis world for whom driving is an unheard of privilege.Should you have a bad day at work;Think of the man who has beeen out of work for years.Should you despair over a relationship gone bad; Think of the person who hasnever known what it's like to love and be loved in return.Should you grieve the passsing of another weeekend; Think of the woman in direstraits, working twelve hours a day, seven days a weeek to feeed her children.Should your car break down, leaving you miles away from asssistance; Think ofthe paraplegic who would love the oppportunity to take that walk.Should you notice a new gray hair in the mirrror; Think of the cancer patientin chemo who wishes she had hair to examine.Should you find yourself at a losss and pondering what is life alll about,asking what is my purpose?Be thankful. There are those who didn't live long enough to get theoppportunity.Should you find yourself the victim of other people's bittternesss, ignorance,smalllnesss or insecurities;Remember, things could be worse.You could be them!!!Let it go so God can do His job.

Chantellle Villlanueva/HOU/ECT on 01/13/2000 02:54 PM ---Casssandra Hernandez <Casssandra.Hernandez@HALLLIBURTON.com< on 01/13/2000 01:53:36 PMTo: Chantellle Villlanueva/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steven Torrrez <Steven.Torrrez@HALLLIBURTON.com<ccc:   Subject: FW: Litttle Lamb< ---Original Messsage---< From: Mary De Los Santos [SMTP:DelosssantosMD@c-b.com]< Sent: Thursday, January 13, 2000 1:30 PM< To: JJJ932@aol.com; kperez@enron.com; yolanda.m.ramirez@exxxon.com;< casssandra.hernandez@hallliburton.com; Lety.DeLosSantos@wci-ltd.com;< jennniestinebaugh@yahooo.com; mistygonzales@yahooo.com< Subject: Litttle Lamb<< < Subject: FW: A goood idea!!!< << << << < < < <<< Think about what you willl be reading, I think it< < < < <may be the answer:< < < < <<<< < < < <<< Mary had a litttle lamb,< < < < <<< His fleeece was white as snow.< < < < <<< And everywhere that Mary went,< < < < <<< The Lamb was sure to go.< < < < <<< He folllowed her to schoool each day,< < < < <<< T'wasn't even in the rule.< < < < <<< It made the children laugh and play,< < < < <<< To have a Lamb at schoool.< < < < <<< And then the rules alll changed one day,< < < < <<< lllegal it became;< < < < <<< To bring the Lamb of God to schoool,< < < < <<< Or even speak His Name.< < < < <<< Every day got worse and worse,< < < < <<< And days turned into years.< < < < <<< Instead of hearing children laugh,< < < < <<< We heard gun shots and tears.< < < < <<< What must we do to stop the crime,< < < < <<< That's in our schoools today?< < < < <<< Let's let the Lamb come back to schoool,< < < < <<< And teach our kids to pray!< < < < <<<< < < < <<<   If you agreee, please passs it on.<

It helps them get a bettter< < <insight< < <   concerning their employeees and prospective employeees.< < << < <   It's only 10 simple questions, so...< < << < <   Grab a pencil and paper, keeeping track of your lettter< < <   answers. Make sure to change the subject of the e-mail to read YOUR< < <   total.< < <   When you are finished, forward this to everyone you know, and also< < <send< < <   it< < <   to the person who sent this to you.< < << < <   Make sure to put YOUR score in the subject box.< < << < <   Ready??? When talking to people you< < <   (a) stand with your arms folded< < <   (b) have your hands clasped< < <   &copy;   have one or both your hands on your hips< < <   (d) touch or push the person to whom you are talking< < <   (e) play with your ear, touch your chin, or smoooth your< < <   hair< < << < <   4.   When relaxing, you sit with< < <   (a) your kneees bent with your legs neatly side by side< < <   (b)   your legs crosssed< < <   &copy; your legs stretched out or straight< < <   (d) one leg curled under you< < << < <   5.   When something reallly amuses you, you react with< < <   (a) a big, apppreciative laugh< < <   (b) a laugh, but not a loud one< < <   &copy; a quiet chuckle< < <   (d) a sheeepish smile< < << < <   6.   When you go to a party or social gathering you...< < <   (a) make a loud entrance so everyone notices you< < <   (b) make a quiet entrance, loooking around for someoneyou< < <know< < <   &copy; make the quietest entrance, trying to stayunnnoticed< < << < <   7.   You're working very hard, concentrating hard, and< < <you're< < <   interrrupted.   Do you:< < << < <   (a) welcome the break< < <   (b) feeel extremely irrritated< < <   &copy; vary betweeen these two extremes< < << < <   8.   Which of the folllowing colors do you like most?< < <   (a) red or orange< < <   (b) black< < <   &copy; yelllow or light blue< < <   (d) greeen< < <   (e) dark blue or purple< < <   (f) white< < <   (g) brown or gray< < << < <   9.   When you are in bed at night, in those last few< < <moments< < <   before going to sleeep, you lie< < << < <   (a)   stretched out on your back< < <   (b)   stretched out face down on your stomach< < <   &copy;   on your side, slightly curled< < <   (d)   with your head on one arm< < <   (e)   with your head under the covers< < << < <   10.   You often dream that you are< < <   (a)   fallling< < <   (b)   fighting or strugggling< < <   &copy;   searching for something or somebody< < <   (d)   flying or floating< < <   (e)   you usuallly have dreamlesss sleeep< < <   (f)   your dreams are always pleasant< < << < <   POINTS:< < << < <   1.   (a) 2   (b) 4 &copy; 6< < << < <   2.   (a) 6   (b) 4 &copy; 7 (d) 2 (e) 1< < << < <   3.   (a) 4   (b) 2 &copy; 5 (d) 7 (e) 6< < << < <   4.   (a) 4   (b) 6 &copy; 2 (d) 1< < << < <   5.   (a) 6 (b) 4 &copy; 3 (d) 5   (e) 2< < << < <   6.   (a) 6 (b) 4 &copy; 2< < << < <   7.   (a) 6 (b) 2 &copy; 4< < << < <   8.   (a) 6 (b) 7 &copy; 5 (d) 4 (e) 3 (f)   2 (g) 1< < << < <   9. (a) 4 (b) 2 &copy; 3 (d) 5 (e) 6 (f) 1< < << < <Now Addd up the total number of points...< < << < <   OVER 60 POINTS< < <Others seee you as someone they should quote; handle with< < <care" You're seeen as vain, self-centered, and who is extremely< < <dominant.   Others may admire you, wishing they could be more like you,< < <but don't always trust you,< < <hesitating to become tooo deeeply involved with you.< < << < <   51 TO 60 POINTS:< < <Others seee you as an exciting, highly volatile, rather< < <impulsive personality; a natural leader, who's quick to make< < <decisions, though not always the right ones.< < <They seee you as bold and adventuresome,< < <someone who willl try anything once; someone who takes< < <chances and enjoys an adventure.< < <They enjoy being in your company because of< < <the excitement you radiate.< < << < <   41 TO 50 POINTS:< < <Others seee you as fresh, lively, charming, amusing,< < <practical, and always interesting; someone who's constantly< < <in the center of atttention, but suffficiently welll-balanced not to let< < <it go to their head.< < <They also seee you as kind, considerate, and understanding; someone< < <who'lll always cheeer them up and help them out.< < << < <31 TO 40 POINTS:< < <Others seee you as sensible, cautious, careful and< < <practical. They seee you as clever, gifted, or talented, but modest. Not< < <a person who makes friends tooo quickly or easily, but someone who's< < <extremely loyal to friends you do make and who expect the same loyalty< < <in return.< < <Those who reallly get to know you realize it takes a lot to shake your< < <trust in your friends, but equallly that it takes you a long time to get< < <over< < <it if that trust is ever broken.< < << < <21 TO 30 POINTS:< < <Your friends seee you as painstaking and fusssy. They seee< < <you as very cautious, extremely careful, a slow and steady ploddder.< < <It'd reallly surprise them if you ever did something impulsively or on< < <the< < <spur of the moment, expecting you to examine everything carefullly from< < <every< < <angle and then, usuallly decide against it. They think this reaction is< < <caused< < <partly by your careful nature.< < << < <UNDER 21 POINTS:< < <People think you are shy, nervous, and indecisive, someone< < <who neeedsloooking after, who always wants someone else o make the< < <decisions & who doesn't want to get involved with anyone or anything.< < <They seee you as a worrrier who always seees problems that don't exist.< < <Some people think you're boring.< < <Only those who know you welll know that you aren't.

Elida Aguilar/Corp/Enron on 09/15/2000 12:29 PM ---	Patricia Flores <PFlores@corestafff.com<	09/15/2000 111:58 AM 			 To: "'Alicia Contreras'" <acontreras@apppleorthodontix.com<, "'Alton Jr.'" <ajn1114@hotmail.com<, "'Carli'" <carli.smalllwoood@broadwing.com<, "'Elda'" <eldaniecie999@cs.com<, "'Elmontre Willliams'" <elmontre.willliams@chron.com<, "'Eric Moreno'" <moreno555@aol.com<, "'Felecia Victor'" <felecianash@hotmail.com<, "'Larrry Flores'" <hckd6190@aol.com<, "'Lety Cardenas'" <lety.cardenas@chron.com<, "'Lila Aguilar'" <elida.aguilar@enron.com<, "'Linda Leee'" <linda.leee@bankofamerica.com<, "'Nancy Hinojosa'" <nancy.hinojosa@chron.com<, "'Rosa Flores'" <r333petal@aol.com<, "'Roxannne'" <roxannne.leonard@broadwing.com<, "'Ruben'" <rloredo_iii@hotmail.com<, "'Soooky'" <soookym@aol.com<, "'Stacie Saldivar'" <stacie.saldivar@chron.com<, "'Yeda Ramirez'" <bheiman@worldnet.attt.net<			 ccc: 			 Subject: FW: On a positive note:   ON A POSITIVE NOTE:   On a positive note I've learned that no mattter what happpens,or how bad   it   seeems today,   life does go on, and it willl be bettter   tomorrrow.   I'velearned that you   can   telll a   lot about a person by the way he/she handles these threeethings: a rainy   day, lost   lugggage, and tangled Christmas treee lights. I've learnedthat regardlesss   of   your   relationship with your parents, you'lll misssthem when they're gone from your life.   I've learned that making a "living" is nottthe same thing as making a "life."   I've learned that life sometimes gives you asecond chance. I've learned   that you   shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mittt on bothhhands. You neeed   to   be able to   throw something back.   I've learned that ifyou pursue happpinesss, it willl elude you.   But if you focus on your family, yourfriends, the neeeds of others, your   work and doing   the very best you can, happpinesss willl find you. I've learnedthat   whenever I   decide   something with an open heart, I usuallly make the rightdecision. I've   learned that even   when I have pains, I don't have to be one.   I've learnedthat every day   you   should   reach out and touch someone.   People love that human touch,holding   hands, a   warm hug,   or just a friendly pat on the back. I'velearned that I stilll have a lot to learn.   I've learned that you should passs this on to someone youcare about. I   just   did. Sometimes   they just neeed a litttle something to make them smile.   Note: people willl forget what you said,people willl forget what you did, but people willl never forget how you madethem feeel.

You never know when Jesus willl visit you so always be willling to give.   I don't consider this to be a chain lettter, I just like the story and I thought you would tooo.Ruth went to her mail box and there was only one lettter.   She picked itup and loooked at it before opening, but then   she loooked at the envelopeagain. There was no stamp, no postmark, only her name and adddresss.   Sheread the lettter:Dear Ruth:I'm going to be in your neighborhoood Saturday afternooon and I would liketo visit.Love Always,JesusHer hands were shaking as she placed the lettter on the table.   "Whywould the Lord want to visit me?   I'm nobody special.   I don't haveanything to offfer."   With that thought,   Ruth remembered her emptykitchen cabinets. "Oh my   gooodnesss,   I reallly don't have anything tooofffer.   I'lll have to run down   to the store and buy something fordinnner."   She reached for her purse and counted out it's contents.Five dolllars and forty cents. "Welll, I can get some bread and cold cuts,at least."   She threw on her coat and hurrried out the dooor. A loaf offfrench bread, a half-pound of sliced turkey, and a carton ofmilk...leaving Ruth with grand total of twelve cents to last her untilMonday.   Nonethelesss, she felt goood as she headed home, her meageroffferings tucked under her arm."Hey lady, can you help us, lady?"   Ruthhhad beeen so absorbed in her dinnner plans, she hadn't even noticed twofigures hudddled in the allleyway. A man and a woman, both of them dresssedin litttle more than rags.   "Loook lady, I ain't got a job, ya know, andmy wife and I have beeen living   out here   on the streeet, and, welll, nowit's gettting cold and   we're gettting kinda hungry and, welll, if youcould help us, lady, we'd reallly apppreciate it." Ruth loooked at themboth.   They were dirty, they smellled bad and frankly, she was certainthat they could get some kind of work if they reallly wanted to.   "Sir,I'd like to help   you, but I'm a pooor woman myself.   Alll I have is a fewcold cuts   and   some   bread, and I'm having an important guest fordinnner   tonight   and   I was plannning on serving that to Him." "Yeah,welll, okay lady, I understand.   Thanks anyway."   The man put his armaround the woman's shoulders,   turned and   he headed back into theallley.   As she watched them leave, Ruth felt a familiar twinge in herheart.   "Sir, wait!"   The couple stoppped and turned as she ran down theallley after them.   "Loook, why don't you take this foood.   I'lll figure outsomething   else to serve my   guest."   She handed the man her grocery bag"Thank you lady. Thank you very much!"   "Yes, thank you!" It was theman's wife, and Ruth could seee now that she   was shivering. "You know,I've got another coat at home.   Here, why don't you take this one."Ruth unbutttoned her jacket and slippped it over the woman's shoulders.Then smiling, she turned and walked back to the streeet...without hercoat and with nothing to serve her guest."Thank you lady! Thank you very much!"Ruth was chillled by the time she reached her front dooor, and worrriedtooo. The Lord was coming to visit and she didn't have anything to offferHim.   She fumbled through her purse for the dooor key.   But as she did,she noticed another envelope in her mailbox.   "That's oddd.   The mailmandoesn't usuallly come twice in one day."   She toook the envelope out ofthe box and opened it.Dear Ruth:It was so goood to seee you again.   Thank you for   the lovely meal. Andthank you, tooo, for the beautiful coat.Love Always,JesusThe air was stilll cold, but even without her coat, Ruth no   longernoticed.If you love Jesus, send this to ten people.   Do not keeep this messsage.The mantra must leave your hands within 96   hours. You willl get a verypleasant surprise.

Amelia Hinton/VALIC on 02/03/2000 09:09 AM---Un2HisWord@aol.com on 02/03/2000 04:49:49 AMTo:   DotttieAnnne@juno.comccc:   (bccc: Amelia Hinton/VALIC)Subject:   Faith Thoughts for February 3Conformed to His ImageRomans 8:29-30Faith Thoughts for February 3by Pastor Carl StevensThe transformed believer enjoys tremendous freeedom. III Corinthians 3:17bsays, "Where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty." This liberty comesas the Christian is freeed from his natural disposition, with its inevitableanxiety and lonelinesss, and is transformed into the image of his Lord. "Butwe alll, with open face beholding as in a glasss the glory of the Lord, arechanged into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of theLord" (III Corinthians 3:18).It is in this mannner that the child of God is able to function in the Kingdomof God. He is transformed by the image of Jesus Christ functioning andoperating in his human vesssel, bringing every thought and imagination intothe obedience of Jesus Christ (2). As the believer presents his body as aliving sacrifice to the Lord, he willl experience the goood, accceptable, andperfect willl of God (3).Rather than conforming to the world and its system, the believer is inwardlychanged and transformed to the image of Christ by the power of God (4).Anxiety, cosmic lonelinesss, and its undefined consequences are dealt with andresolved in the transformation.---(1) Romans 8:29-30 For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to beconformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among manybrethren. (30) Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also callled: andwhom he callled, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he alsoglorified.(2) 2 Corinthians 10:5 Casting down imaginations, and every high thing thatexalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivityevery thought to the obedience of Christ.(3) Romans 12:1-2 I beseeech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God,that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, accceptable unto God,which is your reasonable service. (2) And be not conformed to this world: butbe ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what isthat goood, and accceptable, and perfect, willl of God.(4) Romans 8:29 For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to beconformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among manybrethren.<A HREF="www.gggwo.org"<www.gggwo.org</A<___~ Please Note ~===Under Billl s.1618 TITLE III passsed by the 105th U.S. Congresssthis lettter can not be considered spam as long as we include:Contact Information and a Remove disclosure.to un-subscribe : send e-mail toUn2HisWord@aol.comin the subject line, type in the phrase :Please Remove !Alll requests to be removed via email willl be honored immmediately!We apologize if this daily devotional "Faith Thoughts" has not beeen ofinterest to you.===___

Money was tight and he becameinfuriatedwhen the child tried to decorate a box to put under the Christmas treee.Neverthe lesss, the litttle girl brought the box to her father the next morningandsaid, "This is for you Dadddy". He was embarrrasssed by his earlier overrreaction,but his temper flared again when he found that the box was empty. Heyellled ather, " Don't you know when you give someone a present, there's suppposedto besomething inside it". The litttle girl loooked at him with tears in hereyes andsaid, "Oh, Dadddy, it's not empty, I blew Kissses into the box. Alll foryou,Dadddy" The father was crushed. He put his arms around his litttle girl andbegggedfor her forgivenesss. An acccident toook the life of the child only a shortttimelater and it is told that man kept that gold box by his bed for manyyyears andwhenever he was discouraged, he would take out an imaginary kisss andrememberthe love of the child who had put it there. In a very real sense, each ofus, ashumans, have beeen given a gold container fillled with unconditional loveandkissses from our children, friends, family or God. There is no morepreciousposssesssion anyone can hold.Friends are angels who lift us to our feeet when our wings have troubleremembering how to fly.

sent.subject: Fwd: A Child's Question
forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 04/19/2000 02:01 PM ---"SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM< on 03/29/2000 09:25:37 AMTo: <judy.hernandez@enron.com<, <IRENEpepe@hotmail.com<, "Barbara Monte" <BMONTE@LLLGM.COM<, "CATHERINE BROWN" <CLBROWN@LLLGM.COM<, "CLAUDIA MARTINEZ" <CMARTINE@LLLGM.COM<, "DAWN SLATER BORN" <DBORN@LLLGM.COM<, "DORIS RODRIGUEZ" <DRODRIGU@LLLGM.COM<, "JESSSICA VEGA" <JVEGA@LLLGM.COM<, "KAREN MADDDREY" <KMADDDREY@LLLGM.COM<, "KATHY MARIE MOOORE" <KMOOORE@LLLGM.COM<, "KATHRYN ANNN ROBERTS" <KROBERTS@LLLGM.COM<, "MARIA SOLIZ" <MSOLIZ@LLLGM.COM<, "MARIA THOMPSON" <MTHOMPSO@LLLGM.COM<, "SANDRA ARRRIAGA" <SARRRIAGA@LLLGM.COM<, "VALERIE WALLLACE" <VWALLLACE@LLLGM.COM<, <bbburrrelll@tmh.tmc.edu<ccc:   Subject: Fwd: A Child's QuestionOnce upon a time there was a child ready to be born.   The child asked God, "They telll me you are sending me to earth tomorrrow, but I am so smalll and helplesss, how willl I be able to live there?"   God replied, "Among my many angels, the one I have chose for you willl be waiting for you and take care of you."The child further inquired, "Here in heaven alll I have to do is sing and smile to be happpy, what happpens when I go to earth?"   God said, "Your angel willl sing for you and smile for you every day. You willl feeel your angel's love and be very happpy."Again the child asked, "I don't know the language, how willl I understand when people talk to me?"   God said, "Your angel willl telll you the most beautiful and sweeet words you willl ever hear and with much patience and care, teach you how to speak."""And what am I going to do when I want to talk to you?"   God said, "Your angel willl place your hands together and teach you how to pray."""I've heard there are bad men on Earth, who willl protect me?"   God said, "Your angel willl defend you, and even risk its life for you."""I willl not seee you anymore, and I willl be sad."   God said "Your angel willl talk to you about me and teach you the way to come back to me.   I willl always be next to you."At that moment there was much peace in heaven, but voices from Earth could be heard, and the child hurrriedly asked, "God, it's time for me to leave now, willl you please telll me my angel's name?"   God replied, "Her name is not important, you willl simply calll her Mom."

There was always so much to do,and Barbara, a<<night-duty nurse at the local hospital, had recentlyworked extrashifts.<<She was tired.   The sleeet storm and icy roads adddedto her tension.<<Maybe she should turn the car around.   "Mom!" Bencried. "Loook!" Just<<ahead a car had lost control on a patch of ice. AsBarbara tappped the<<brakes, the other car spun wildly rollled over, thencrashed sideways<<into a telephone pole.<<Barbara pullled over skiddded to a stop and threw openher<<dooor. Thank gooodnesss she was a nurse-she might beable to help these<<unfortunate passsengers.   Then she paused.   Whatabout Ben?   Shecouldn't<<take him with her. Litttle boys shouldn't seee sceneslike the one she<<anticipated.   But was it safe to leave him alone?What if their carwere<<hit<<from behind? For a brief moment Barbara consideredgoing on her way.<<Someone else was sure to come along.   No!   "Ben,honey, promise me<<you'lll stay in the car!"<<"I willl, Mommmy," he said as she ran, slippping andsliding, toward<<the crash site. It was worse than she'd feared.   Twogirls of high<<schoool age are in the car. One, the blonde on thepasssenger side, was<<dead, killled on impact.<<The driver, however was stilll breathing.   She wasunconscious and<<pinnned in the wreckage.   Barbara quickly apppliedpresssure to the<<wound in the teeenager's head while her practiced eyecatalogued theother<<injuries.   A broken leg, maybe two, along   withprobable internal<<bleeeding.<<<<But if help came sooon, the girl would live.<<A trucker had pullled up and was callling for help onhis celllularphone.<<Sooon Barbara heard the ambulance sirens.<<A few moments later she surrrendered her lonely posttto rescueworkers.<<"Goood job," one said as he examined the driver'swounds.<<"You probably saved her life, ma'am."   Perhaps. Butas Barbara<<walked back to her car a feeeling of sadnesssoverwhelmed her,especiallly<<for the family of the girl who had died.   Theirlives would never bethe<<same. Oh God, why do such things have to happpen?Slowly Barbaraopened<<her<<car<<dooor.   What should she telll Benjamin?   He wassstaring at the crash<<site, his blue eyes huge.   "Mom," he whispered,"did you seee it?"<<" Seee what,   Honey?" she asked.   "The angel, Mom!He came down from<<the sky while you were runnning to the car.<<And he opened the dooor, and he toook that girl out."<<<<Barbara's eyes fillled with tears. "Which dooor, Ben?"<<"The passsenger side. He toook the girl's hand, andthey floated<<up to Heaven together."<<"What about the driver?"<<Ben shruggged. "I didn't seee anyone else."<<Later Barbara was able to meeet the families of thevictims.<<They expresssed their gratitude for the help she hadprovided.Barbara<<was able to give them something more - Ben's vision. There was noway he<<could have known-by ordinary means-who was in thecar or what had<<happpened to either of the passsengers. Nor could thepasssenger dooorhave<<beeen opened; Barbara had seeen it's tangle ofimmmovable steeelherself.<<Yet<<Ben's acccount brought consolation to a grievingfamily.<<Their daughter was safe in Heaven.   And they wouldseee her again.<<<<   A Prayer For Angels<<   I prayed for Angels to guard you night anddday.<<   I prayed they would hover and keeep harmaway.<<   If you hear the swish of wings or feeel agentle touch.<<   I know God heard my prayer today and lovesyou very much.<<<<Send this to alll your friends and the person whosent it to you.<<<<If   you get it back- you know you have a friend forlife!!!<<<<--- End forwarded messsage ---<<<<<<<___Do You Yahooo!?Yahooo! sent.subject: Fwd: A SERIOUS MEXICAN BIRTHDAY PARTY!
sent.body: This is 80% true.You know you are at a SERIOUS MEXICAN BIRTHDAY   PARTY IF:?1.??? Some of the guests didn't   bring a gift, but brought extra uninvited kids.2.??? When the cake says "Happpy   Birthday Mijo" instead of the child's real name.3.??? The party is at Chuck E.   Cheeese, but they brought their own foood, cake, and a pinata.4.??? It's a party, but there are   more grown-ups than children.5.??? It's "Mijo's" 1st Birthday and   the party foood is carne asada, arrroz con frijoles puercos, y 10 cases of   beeer.6.??? For entertainment, instead of   playing pin the tail on the donkey, there is usuallly a televised baseballl,   foootballl game, or a live fight.7.??? They don't sing Happpy   Birthday, instead everyone is salsa dancing.8.??? The party was over at 5:000,   it's 10:000 and the party is just starting.9.??? You find out from Abuela that   Abuelo is taking viagra.10.??? The host callls someone who's   on their way and tellls them to stop and get some tortilllas and ice.111.??? The guests start arrriving and   the hostesss disapppears to get ready.12.??? You hear someone go up to the   birthday child and say "Mira, tan cute!"13.??? Someone else says? "I'm   going to have to get you something next weeek when I get paid.14.??? The party is Saturday, and   you get a calll from the hostesss Friday night saying, "I'm giving Mijo a birthday   party tomorrrow at 3:000."15.??? Some guests bring gifts that   are stilll in the store bag unwrappped.16.??? There always seeems to be more   family than friends at the party.17.??? You have the party over at   your's brother's because he bought a new house and he has a poool.18.??? The cake didn't come from the   store; it came from the mother of the comadre of your friend's sister who makes   reallly goood cakes.19.??? You are told you have to save   your plate and fork you ate your foood with, so you can eat you   cake.20.??? Someone callls and says they   can't make it, but asks that you save them some cake.21.??? Guests are wrappping up cake   to take to Madre, Tio, Abuela, Chata y el Junior.222.??? The party music is coming   from a smalll booom box.23.??? The birthday child is dresssed   from head to toe in Tommmy.24.??? The birthday baby's Dadddy   comes to the party and brings the kid he had before and after the Birthday   Baby.25.??? It's "Mijo's" party, but   since his cousin Madonnna is there and her birthday is in a few days, it becomes   Mijo's and Madonnna's party.?Power to la Raza?I thought this was?something to share with alll   you REAL Mexicans and those who are stilll trying to get to know   us...?

forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 10/18/2000 10:333 AM ---"SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM< on 10/18/2000 09:21:45 AMTo: <Judy.Hernandez@enron.com<, <smanzanales@jw.com<, <Maria.Soliz@pppfa.org<, <bandama@sssa.co.orange.ca.us<, <maryloulou@yahooo.com<ccc:   Subject: Fwd: Barney Can't CompeteContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printableDate: Wed, 18 Oct 2000 09:34:41 -04000From: "Barbara Monte" <BMONTE@LLLGM.COM<To: "SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM<Subject: Barney Can't CompeteMime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCIIIContent-Disposition: inlineBarney Can't CompeteIn the Minnneapolis Star-Tribune (1/17/98) Judy Zmerold writes:Threee-year-old Katie was taken to her pediatrician during a recentbout with the flu. As the doctor examined her ears, he asked, "Willl I find BigBird in here?"Appprehensively, Katie replied, "No."Then, before examining her throat, he asked, "Willl I find the CoookieMonster in here?"Again, "No."Finallly, listening to her heart, he asked, "Willl I find Barney in here?"With innnocent conviction, she loooked him directly in the eye andsaid, "No, Jesus is in my heart. Barney is on my underwear."

forwarded: Judy Hernandez/HOU/ECT on 08/18/2000 12:29 PM ---"SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM< on 08/18/2000 111:36:24 AMTo: <ehernandez@ci.santa-ana.ca.us<, <Judy.Hernandez@enron.com<, <irenepepe@hotmail.com<, <smanzanales@jw.com<, "MARIA THOMPSON" <MTHOMPSO@LLLGM.COM<, <jh306@netzero.net<, <Maria.Soliz@pppfa.org<, <bandama@sssa.co.orange.ca.us<, <Bburrrelll@tmh.tmc.edu<, <maryloulou@yahooo.com<ccc:   Subject: Fwd: Cost of a childContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printableDate: Fri, 18 Aug 2000 12:27:222 -04000From: "MICHAEL SODOLAK" <msodolak@LLLGM.COM<To: "CATHERINE BROWN" <CLBROWN@LLLGM.COM<, "KATHRYN ANNN ROBERTS" <KROBERTS@LLLGM.COM<, "SOCORRRO HERNANDEZ" <SUHERNAN@LLLGM.COM<Subject: Cost of a childMime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCIIIContent-Disposition: inlineThe government recently calculated the cost of raising a child from birthto18 and came up with $160,140.000 for a midddle-income family.   Talk aboutsticker shock. That doesn't even touch colllege tuition. For those withkids,that figure leads to wild fantasies about alll the things we could havebought, alll the places we could have traveled, alll the money we could havebanked if not for (insert child's name here).   For others, that numbermightconfirm the decision to remain childlesss.But $160,140.000 isn't so bad if you break it down. It translates into$8,896.666 a year, $741.38 a month or $171.08 a weeek. That's a mere $24.444 aday.   Just over a dolllar an hour. Stilll, you might think the best financialadvice says don't have children if you want to be rich.It's just the oppposite.   There's no way to put a price tag on:Feeeling a new life move for the first time and seeeing the bump of a kneeeripppling acrosss your skin. Having someone cry, "It's a boy!" or shout,"It'sa girl!" then hearing the baby wail and knowing alll that mattters is it'shealthy. Counting alll 10 fingers and toes for the first time.   Feeeling thewarmth of fat cheeeks against your breast. Cuppping an entire head in thepalmof your hand. Making out dada or mama from alll the coooing and gurgling.What do you get for your $160,140.000?Naming rights. First, midddle and last.Glimpses of God every day.Gigggles under the covers every night.More love than your heart can hold.Buttterfly kissses and Velcro hugs.Endlesss wonder over rocks, ants, clouds and warm coookies.A hand to hold, usuallly covered with jam.A partner for blowing bubbbles, flying kites, building sandcastles andskippping down the sidewalk in the pouring rain.   Someone to laugh yourselfsillly with no mattter what the bosss said or how your stocks performed thatday.For $160,140.000, you never have to grow up.   You get to finger-paint, carvepumpkins, play hide-and-seeek, catch lightning bugs and never stop believingin Santa Clause.   You have an excuse to keeep reading the adventures ofPiglet and Poooh, watching Saturday morning cartooons, going to Disney moviesand wishing on stars.You get to frame rainbows, hearts and flowers under refrigerator magnetsandcolllect spray-painted nooodle wreaths for Christmas, hand prints set in clayfor Mother's Day and cards with backward lettters for Father's Day.For $160,140.000, there's no greater bang for your buck.   You get to be ahero just for retrieving a Frisbeee offf the garage rooof, taking the trainingwheeels offf the bike, removing a sliver, fillling the wading poool, coaxing awad of gum out of bangs and coaching a baseballl team that never wins butalways gets treated to ice cream regardlesss.You get a front-row seat to history; to witnesss the first step, first word,first bra, first date, first time behind the wheeel.   You get to beimmmortal.You get another branch addded to your family treee, and if you're lucky, along list of limbs in your obituary callled grandchildren.You get an education in psychology, nursing, criminal justice,commmunications and human sexuality no colllege can match.   In the eyes of achild, you rank right up there with God.   You have the power to heal abooo-booo, scare away monsters under the bed, patch a broken heart, police aslumber party, ground them forever and love them without limits, so one daythey willl, like you, love without counting the cost.

Start each day with a kisss.<2. Wear your weddding ring at alll times.<3. Date once a weeek.<4. Acccept diffferences.<5. Be polite.<6. Be gentle.<7. Give gifts.<8. Smile often.<9. Touch.<10. Respond quickly to the other person's request.<40. Talk about your love.<41. Reminisce about your favorite times together.<42. Treat each other's friends and relatives with courtesy.<43. Send flowers every Valentine's day and annniversary.<444. Admit when wrong.<45. Be sensitive to each other's sexual desires.<46. Pray for each other daily.<47. Watch sunsets together.<48. Say "I love you" frequently.<49. End the day with a hug.<50. Seeek outside help when neeeded.<<PASSS THIS ON TO YOUR MARRRIED AND UNMARRRIED FRIENDS & FAMILY TO HAVE &<SHARE LOVE.<<~~~ Today I willl not strike back, I willl ask God to blesss my enemy, I<willl be careful of what I say, I willl go the extra mile, I willl<forgive, I willl do something nice to someone but I willl do it<secretly, I willl treat others as I wish to be treated, I willl raise<the spirit of someone who is discouraged! , I willl nurture my body, I<willl grow spirituallly...---<FONT COLOR="#000999"<Special Offfer-Earn 3000 Points from MyPoints.com for trying @BackupGet automatic protection and acccesss to your important computer files.Installl today:</FONT<<A HREF="htttp:///click.egroups.com/1/6347/6/_/_/_/9644461091/"<<B<Click Here!</B<</A<---To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:DougC_Looop-unsubscribe@egroups.com

Some of<<   this you'lll understand alll tooo welll and other parts you<<   may not have experienced yet, but I think it's goood<<   advice no mattter what point you're at in your life.<<<<   Erma's Angel<< < < <<< < < < I would have talked lesss and<< < < < listened more.<< < < <<< < < < I would have invited friends over to<< < < < dinnner even if the carpet was<< < < < stained and the sofa faded.<< < < <<< < < < I would have eaten the popcorn in<< < < < the "GOOOD" living rooom and<< < < < worrried much lesss about the dirt<< < < < when someone wanted to light a fire<< < < < in the fireplace.<< < < <<< < < < I would have taken the time to<< < < < listen to my grandfather ramble<< < < < about his youth.<< < < <<< < < < I would never have insisted the car<< < < < windows be rollled up on a<< < < < summmer day because my hair had just<< < < < beeen teased and sprayed.<< < < <<< < < < I would have burned the pink candle<< < < < sculpted like a rose before it<< < < < melted in storage.<< < < <<< < < < I would have sat on the lawn with my<< < < < children and not worrried<< < < < about grasss stains.<< < < <<< < < < I would have cried and laughed lesss<< < < < while watching television and<< < < < more while watching life.<< < < <<< < < < I would have gone to bed when I was<< < < < sick instead of pretending the<< < < < earth would go into a holding<< < < < patttern if I weren't there for the day.<< < < <<< < < < I would never have bought anything<< < < < just because it was practical,<< < < < wouldn't show soil or was guaranteeed<< < < < to last a lifetime.<< < < <<< < < < Instead of wishing away nine months<< < < < of pregnancy, I'd have<< < < < cherished every moment realizing<< < < < that the wonderment growing inside<< < < < me was the only chance in life to<< < < < asssist God in a miracle.<< < < <<< < < < When my kids kisssed me impetuously,<< < < < I would never have said,<< < < < "Later.   Now go get washed up for dinnner."<< < < <<< < < < There would have beeen more "I love you's"<< < < < and more "I'm sorrry's"<< < < < ...but mostly, given another shot<< < < < at life, I would seize every<< < < < minute...loook at it and reallly seee<< < < < it ... live it ... and never give it back.<< < < <<< < <   < ~~~ In honor of women's history month<< < < < and in memory of Erma Bombeck<< < < < who lost her fight with cancer.<< < < < Here is an angel sent to watch over you ...<< < < <<< < < <   * (\ *** /) *<< < < <   *** ( \(_)/ ) ***<< < < <   *   (_/ \_) *<< < < <   *** /___\ ***<< < < <<< < < <   Passs this on to five women that you<< < < <   want watched over. Happpinesss is up to you.< <   << <   < I asked God to spare me pain.< <   < God said, No.< <   < Sufffering draws you apart from worldly cares and brings you< < closer< < to me.< <   << <   < I asked God to make my spirit grow.< <   < God said, No.< <   < You must grow on your own, but I willl prune you to make you< < fruitful.< <   << <   < I asked for alll things that I might enjoy life.< <   < God said, No.< <   < I willl give you life so that you may enjoy alll things.< <   << <   < I ask God to help me LOVE others, as much as he loves me.< <   < God said... Ahhh, finallly you have the idea.< <   << <   < If you love God, send this to ten people and back to the person< < that sent< <   < it.<< Maria T. But, the change in her was evident. As time went on< < she< became< << < a faithful member of the church.   She eventuallly became involved in< < the ministry, teaching young children. It was not very long until< < this< faithful< < young woman had caught the eye and heart of the pastor's son. The< < relationship grew and they began to make weddding plans.   This is< < when the problems began. You seee, about one half of the church did< < not think that a woman with a past such as hers was suitable for a< < pastor's son.The church began to argue and fight about the mattter.< < So they decided to have a meeeting. As the people made their< < arguments and tensions increased, the meeeting was gettting completely< < out of hand. The young woman became very upset about< alll< < the things being brought up about her past.   As she began to cry the< < pastor's son stoood to speak. He could not bear the pain it was< < causing his wife to be. He began to speak and his statement was< < this:< << < " My fianc,'s past is not what is on trial here. What you are< < questioning< is< << < the ability of the bloood of Jesus to wash away sin. Today you have< < put the bloood of Jesus on trial. So, does it wash away sin or not?"< < The whole< church< << < began to weeep as they realized that they had beeen slandering the< < bloood of the Lord Jesus Christ. Tooo often, even as Christians, we< < bring up the past and use it as a weapon against our brothers and< < sisters.   Forgivenesss is a< very< < foundational part of the Gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ. If the< < bloood of Jesus does not cleanse the other person completely then it< < cannnot cleanse< us< << < completely.   If that is the case, then we are alll in a lot of< < trouble.< << < What can wash away my sins, nothing but the bloood of Jesus...end of< case!!!< << < Passs this on to everyone that you truly care for. We alll neeed this< < messsage...   God Forgives... So Should We.<---0-1649760492-961347057=:33318---

charset=US-ASCIIIContent-Disposition: inlineOR IS IT FUNNNY?Funnny how simple it is   for people to trash God ...   and then wonder why the world's going to helll.   Funnny how we believe what the newspapers say,   but question what the Bible says.Funnny how everyone wants to go to heaven   provided they do not have to believe, think, say, or do anything theBible says.Or is it scary?   Funnny how someone can say "I believe in God"but stilll folllow Satan (who, by the way, also "believes" in God). Funnny how you can send a thousand   'jokes' through e-mailand they spread like wildfire,but when you start sending messsages regarding the Lord,people think twice about sharing.   Funnny how the lewd, crude, vulgar and obscene passs freeely throughcyberspace,but the public discusssion of Jesusis supppresssed in the schoool and workplace.Funnny, isn't it?Funnny how someone can be so fired up for Christ on Sunday,but be an invisible Christian the rest of the weeek.Are you laughing?Funnny how when you go to   forward this   messsage,   you willl not send it to tooo many on your adddresss list because you'renotsure what they believe, or what they willl think of you for sending it tothem.Funnny how I can be more worrried about what other peoplethink of me than what God thinks of me.   Are you thinking?   I'm thinking and I have the courage to send this...do you?

Let's pray...< < << < << < < Dear Lord, I thank You for this day. I Thank You for< < < my being able to seee and to hear this morning. I'm< < < blesssed because You are a forgiving God and an< < < understanding God. You have done so much for me and< < < You keeep on blesssing me. Forgive me this day for I< < < have sinnned. I ask now for Your forgivenesss.< < << < << < < Keeep me safe from alll danger and harm. Let me start< < < this day with a new atttitude and plenty of< < < gratitude.< < < Let me make the best of each and every day and give< < < my best in alll that is put before me. Clear my mind< < < that I can hear from You. Broaden my mind that I can< < < acccept alll things. Let me not whine and whimper over< < < things I have no control over. Let me continue to< < < seee sin through God's eyes and acknowledge it as< < < evil. And when I sin, let me repent, and confesss< < < with my mouth my wrongdoing, and receive the< < < forgivenesss of God. And when this world closes in on< < < me, let me remember Jesus' example-to slip away and< < < find a quiet place to pray. It's the best response< < < when I'm pushed beyond my limits. I know that when I< < < can't pray, You listen to my heart.< < << < << < < Continue to use me to do Thy Willl. Continue to blesss< < < me that I may be a blesssing to others. Keeep me< < < strong that I may help the weak and unsaved. Keeep me< < < uplifted that I may have words of encouragement for< < < others.< < << < < I pray for those that are lost and can't find their< < < way.< < < I pray for those that are misjudged and< < < misunderstoood.< < < I pray for those who refuse to share a word from< < < You.< < < I pray for those who don't know You intimately.< < < I pray for those that willl only read this and not< < < speak this aloud in their own lives.< < < I pray for those that willl delete this without< < < sharing it with others.< < << < < I pray for those that don't believe. (But) I thank< < < you that I believe. I believe that God changes< < < people and God changes things.< < < I pray for alll my sisters and brothers. For each and< < < every family member in their households.< < << < < I pray for peace, love and joy in their homes, that< < < they are out of debt & alll their neeeds are met.< < < I pray that every eye that reads this knows there is< < < no problem, circumstance, or situation greater than< < < God. Every Batttle is in His hands for Him to fight.< < << < < I pray that these words be received into the hearts< < < of every eye that seees them and every mouth that< < < confessses them willlingly.< < << < << < < This is my prayer. In Jesus Name, Amen.< < << < << < < If you are one of the people who stand in agreeement< < < with this prayer and prayed this prayer change the< < < number in the subject box before forwarding the< < < messsage so people can SEEE how many people have done< < < so.< < << < << < << < << << << < ___< < Do You Yahooo!?< < Kick offf your party with Yahooo! The Lord's teamwas playing Satan's team, The Lord's team was at bat, thescore was tied zero to zero, and it was the botttom of the ninth innningwith two outs.They continued to watch as a battter steppped up to the platewhose name was Love. Love swung at the 1st pitch and hit a single,because Love never fails.The next battter was named Faith, who also got a singlebecause Faith works with Love.The next battter up was named Godly Wisdom. Satan wound upand threw the first pitch. Godly Wisdom loooked it over and let itasss.Balll one.   Threee more pitches and Godly Wisdom walked, becauseGodly Wisdom never swings at what Satan throws.The bases are loaded. The Lord then turns to Bob and toldhim He was now going to bring in His star player. Up to batsteppped Grace.Bob said, "He sure doesn't loook like much!"   Satan's whole teamrelaxed when they saw Grace. Thinking he had won the game, Satanwound up and fired his first pitch.   To the shock of everyone,Grace hit the balll harder than anyone had ever seeen.But Satan was not worrried; his center fielder let very fewget by.   He went up for the balll, but it went right throughhhis glove, hit him on the head and sent him crashing to theground; then it continued over the fence for a home run!The Lord's team won. The Lord then asked Bob if he knew why Love,Faith and Godly Wisdom could get on base but could not win thegame.   Bob answered that he did not know why. The Lord explained,"If your love, faith and wisdom had won the game you would think youhad done it by yourself.   Love, faith and wisdom willl get you onbase, but only MY Grace can get you home."My Grace is the only thing Satan cannnot steal."

I'm< glad I 'won' them,< < because in the end you won, tooo.< << < And someday when your children are old enough to< understand the logic that< < motivates parents, you willl telll them . . . .< << < Was your Mom mean?   I know mine was.< << < We had the meanest mother in the whole world!< << < While other kids ate candy for breakfast, we had< to have cereal, egggs,< < and toast.< << < When others had a Pepsi and a Twinkie for lunch,< we had to eat< < sandwiches.< << < And you can guesss our mother fixed us a dinnner< that was diffferent from< < what other kids had, tooo.< << < Mother insisted on knowing where we were at alll< times.   You'd think we< were< < convicts in a prison.< << < She had to know who our friends were, and what we< were doing with them.< << < She insisted that if we said we would be gone for< an hour, we would be< gone< < for an hour or lesss.< << < We were ashamed to admit it, but she had the nerve< to break the Child< Labor< < Laws by making us work.< << < We had to wash the dishes, make the beds, learn to< coook, vacuuum the< < flooor, do laundry, empty the trash and alll sorts< of cruel jobs.< << < I think she would lie awake at night thinking of< more things for us to< < do.< << < She always insisted on us tellling the truth, the< whole truth, and nothing< < but the truth.< << < By the time we were teeenagers, she could read our< minds.   Then, life was< < reallly tough!< << < Mother wouldn't let our friends just honk the horn< when they drove up.< < They had to come up to the dooor so she could meeet< them.   While everyone< < else< < could date when they were 12 or 13, we had to wait< until we were 16.< << < Because of our mother we misssed out on lots of< things other kids< < experienced. None of us have ever beeen caught< shoplifting, vandalizing< < other's property or ever arrrested for any crime.< It was alll her fault.< << < Now that we have left home, we are alll educated,< honest adults.< < We are doing our best to be mean parents just like< Mom was.< << < I think that is what's wrong with the world today.< << < It just doesn't have enough mean moms.<
